subject: meta-phosphor: phosphor-ipmi-flash: Update recipe to use meson
commitMessage:
meta-phosphor: phosphor-ipmi-flash: Update recipe to use meson

The new meson now forced only one type of LPC or P2A to be enabled.
The build will fail if both LPC and P2A are enabled.

Out of the given type, only the last package enabled will be used.

Added PACKAGECONFIG conflict feature.

Tested
```
NOTE: Reconnecting to bitbake server...
Loading cache: 100% |###################################################################################################################################################################################################| Time: 0:00:01
Loaded 3939 entries from dependency cache.
ERROR: /workspace/gBMC/buildspace/gbmc/meta-phosphor/recipes-phosphor/ipmi/phosphor-ipmi-flash_git.bb: phosphor-ipmi-flash: PACKAGECONFIG[nuvoton-lpc] Conflict package config 'nuvoton-p2a-mbox' set in PACKAGECONFIG.| ETA:  --:--:--
ERROR: Failed to parse recipe: /workspace/gBMC/buildspace/gbmc/meta-phosphor/recipes-phosphor/ipmi/phosphor-ipmi-flash_git.bb
```

Change-Id: I6ad9317cb5c35aa266ff67eb3b22e9f5f17f359b
Signed-off-by: Willy Tu <wltu@google.com>

I seems like the library in `blob-ipmid` are not copied to `ipmid-providers`.

```
root:~# ls /usr/lib/blob-ipmid/
libbinarystore.so.0        libfirmwareblob.so         
libfirmwarecleanupblob.so  libversionblob.so

root:~# ls /usr/lib/ipmid-providers/
libbinarystore.so.0             libmanualcmds.so.0.0.0
libbinarystore.so.0.0.0         libblobmanager.so               
libethstatscmd.so.0             libstrgfnhandler.so.1
libethstatscmd.so.0.0.0         libstrgfnhandler.so.1.0.0
libgooglesys.so                 libsysintfcmds.so.0
libi2ccmds.so.0                 libsysintfcmds.so.0.0.0
libi2ccmds.so.0.0.0             libusercmds.so.0
libipmi20.so.0                  libusercmds.so.0.0.0
libipmi20.so.0.0.0              libwhitelist.so.0
libmanualcmds.so.0              libwhitelist.so.0.0.0
```

Tested the image built in the presubmit and it seems to work fine.

```
Jan 01 00:00:57 gbs ipmid[671]: Try loading blob from persistent data
Jan 01 00:00:57 gbs ipmid[671]: Stale blob data, resetting internals...
Jan 01 00:00:58 gbs ipmid[671]: config loaded: /flash/bios
Jan 01 00:00:58 gbs ipmid[671]: config loaded: /flash/image
Jan 01 00:00:58 gbs ipmid[671]: config loaded: /flash/dummy
```

```
root@gbs:~# ls /usr/lib/blob-ipmid/
libbinarystore.so.0        libfirmwareblob.so         libfirmwarecleanupblob.so  libversionblob.so
root@gbs:~#  ls /usr/lib/ipmid-providers/
libbinarystore.so.0        libethstatscmd.so.0.0.0    libipmi20.so.0             libstrgfnhandler.so.1      libusercmds.so.0
libbinarystore.so.0.0.0    libgooglesys.so            libipmi20.so.0.0.0         libstrgfnhandler.so.1.0.0  libusercmds.so.0.0.0
libblobmanager.so          libi2ccmds.so.0            libmanualcmds.so.0         libsysintfcmds.so.0        libwhitelist.so.0
libethstatscmd.so.0        libi2ccmds.so.0.0.0        libmanualcmds.so.0.0.0     libsysintfcmds.so.0.0.0    libwhitelist.so.0.0.0
```

Maybe I have some error on my local builds.

Local build
```
Jan 01 00:19:21 gbmc ipmid[9924]: Loading from config with
Jan 01 00:19:21 gbmc ipmid[9924]: Try loading blob from persistent data
Jan 01 00:19:21 gbmc ipmid[9924]: ERROR opening
```

---

seems like there are some issue with system that uses `lpc` type.

System with 
```
PACKAGECONFIG:append = " nuvoton-lpc"
```
will fail to load the blobs.

Looks like we are taking these out now?
do we still need it? Let me test it out a bit more.
Those were only installed by the autotools code.
If we do the wrong thing it should fail to compile because there will be installed FILES that are not assigned to packages.

yeah, I was able to build this locally with no error. So it should be fine.

Need to wait for https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/48403

```
15:22:49 ERROR: phosphor-ipmi-flash-1.0+gitAUTOINC+bcae90026b-r1 do_package: QA Issue: phosphor-ipmi-flash: Files/directories were installed but not shipped in any package:
15:22:57   /usr/lib/blob-ipmid/libfirmwareblob.so
15:22:57   /usr/lib/blob-ipmid/libversionblob.so
15:22:57   /usr/lib/blob-ipmid/libfirmwarecleanupblob.so
15:22:57 Please set FILES such that these items are packaged. Alternatively if they are unneeded, avoid installing them or delete them within do_install.
15:22:57 phosphor-ipmi-flash: 3 installed and not shipped files. [installed-vs-shipped]

I guess I still need the `blob-ipmid`
Done

the `=none` type does not map to what we actually want.

If `-Dlpc-type=none` is added after the `-Dlpc-type=aspeed-lpc`, then it will be `none`. Will need to change it.

I have changed it to add -Dtype=none by default and the appened options will be added to release it.
Ack
This looks unused
Done
Only needed for tools which aren't built in this recipe
Done

Please add PACKAGECONFIG conflicts then.

https://www.yoctoproject.org/docs/latest/mega-manual/mega-manual.html#var-PACKAGECONFIG
Done, PTAL.
Ack

Does this end up building the package in a useful state?  I would suggest dropping these if we can.  Add `-Dp2a-type=none` to lpc PACKAGECONFIG's, maybe, if the meson_options don't default to this.  (Why don't they?)
yeah, the meson does default to this. I guess it is easiest to just remove it here and use the default values directly.
Ack
nit: Generally there are no spaces with command delimiters in PACKAGECONFIG definitions.
Ack
